ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: StackOverflowError
ygData.msgSnippet: Does it happen every time you follow the same steps? Does it happen if you turn FINE logging off? It almost looks like there s an Attribute with a reference

Does it happen every time you follow the same steps?

Does it happen if you turn FINE logging off?

It almost looks like there's an Attribute with a reference loop that 
can't be toString()d; that's what makes me think the logging level might 
be a necessary factor (though of course we'd want to fix the broken 
toString() as well).

- Gordon @ IA

pbaclace wrote:
> I also just saw StackOverflowError in the web UI of heritrix 1.14.2
> right after I clicked Submit Job after composing a job from a previous
> one.
> 
> ------------------begin quote-------------------
> An error occured
> 
> java.lang.StackOverflowError
> 
> java.lang.StackOverflowError
> 	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.append(AbstractStringBuilder.java:391)
> 	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:119)
> 	at javax.management.Attribute.toString(Attribute.java:115)
> 	at java.lang.String.valueOf(String.java:2827)
> 	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:115)
> 	at javax.management.Attribute.toString(Attribute.java:115)
> 	at java.lang.String.valueOf(String.java:2827)
> [...]
> 	at java.lang.String.valueOf(String.java:2827)
> 	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:115)
> 	at javax.management.Attribute.toString(Attribute.java:115)
> 	at java.lang.String.valueOf(String.java:2827)
> 
> You may be able to recover by going back
> ---------------------end quote---------------------
> 
> In my main log output (I had FINE enabled), the last line is:
> 
> FINE org.archive.crawler.admin.ui.JobConfigureUtils checkAttribute
> MBEAN: /crawl-order/robots-honoring-policy user-agents TRANSIENT false
> false false
> 
>
